column2: Hey Rach listen, did you know that during pregnancy your fingers swell up\nto twice their size and never go back.'
(looking at her fingers) Oh my\xc2\x85God! Let me see that! (Grabs the\nbook from him.)'
(laughing) You fall for it every time!'
(entering) Hey!'
Hi!'
I brought you my old maternity clothes! (Sets a bag on the counter.)'
Oh Pheebs that\xc2\x92s so sweet\xc2\x97(Grabs a pair of pants)\xc2\x97Ooh,\nthose are so cute!'

Yeah! And look, (Grabs the pants) see how they expand as the baby grows?\n(There\xc2\x92s a stretchy part in front.) And then after the baby\xc2\x92s born, they\xc2\x92re\ngreat for shoplifting melons.'
(entering) Oh good you\xc2\x92re all here. Thanksgiving tomorrow, four\no\xc2\x92clock. (To Rachel) Oh, guess who I invited. Remember that guy Will Colbert from\nhigh school?'
No.'
He was in Ross\xc2\x92s class\xc2\x85marching band\xc2\x85kinda overweight?\nWell, really overweight. I mean I was his thin friend.'
Wow! I don\xc2\x92t remember him. Honey, are you sure you\xc2\x92re not\ntalking about your imaginary boyfriend.'

No that was Jarred! Wow! I haven\xc2\x92t thought about him in a long
time\xc2\x85 (Stares off into the distance lost in thought.) (Pause) Anyway, umm
Will\xc2\x92s, Will\xc2\x92s here on business and he didn\xc2\x92t have a place to go so I
invited him here.'
Oh that\xc2\x92s nice.'
Oh, and by the way, he\xc2\x92s lost a bunch of weight. I mean he looks\ngoo-ood! Okay, I mean really, really gorgeous! (Joey clears his throat.) I still\nlove Chandler.'
I just want you to say it once in a while.'
All right okay, just so you know, I\xc2\x92m not gonna make a turkey this\nyear.'
What?!'
Well Phoebe doesn\xc2\x92t eat turkey\xc2\x85'
Phoebe!'
Turkey\xc2\x92s are beautiful, intelligent animals!'
No they\xc2\x92re not! They\xc2\x92re ugly and stupid and delicious!'
All right! Okay, it\xc2\x92s just Phoebe. Will\xc2\x92s still on a diet,\nChandler doesn\xc2\x92t eat Thanksgiving food, and Rachel\xc2\x92s having her aversion to\npoultry.'
She is?'
Remember I had to leave the room the other day when you had that roast\nchicken?'
Yeah. But I thought that was because I put the whole thing on my hand and\nmade it walk across the table.'
Anyway, it just doesn\xc2\x92t seem worth it to make a whole turkey for\njust three people. Okay? It\xc2\x92s a lot of work.'
But you gotta have turkey on Thanksgiving! I mean, Thanksgiving with no\nturkey is like-like Fourth of July with no apple pie! Or Friday with no two pizzas!'
All right fine! If it means that much to you! But just\xc2\x97there\xc2\x92s\ngonna be a ton left over.'
No there won\xc2\x92t! I promise I will finish that turkey!'
All right, you\xc2\x92re telling me you can eat an entire turkey in just\none sitting?'

That\xc2\x92s right! \xc2\x91Cause I\xc2\x92m a Tribbiani! (To Rachel) And this\nis what we do! I mean we may not be great thinkers or world leaders, we don\xc2\x92t read a\nlot or run very fast, but damnit! We can eat!'

Hey, isn\xc2\x92t weird to think about how next year at this time\nthey\xc2\x92ll be a little baby at the table? (Chandler turns around in horror.) (Seeing\nhim) Rachel\xc2\x92s! But good to know where you\xc2\x92re at!'
(entering) Hey!'
Hey!'
Happy Thanksgiving!'
You too!'
Anything I can do to help?'

Actually there is. Chandler usually helps me with this, but he\xc2\x92s\nreally into the game so I don\xc2\x92t want to bother him. Could you help me fold these\nnapkins? (Hands her a stack of them.)'
Sure!'
I\xc2\x92m gonna go across the hall to check on the yams.'
Okay. (She starts folding the napkins in half.)'
No! No! No! No sweetie! No! Not like that! We\xc2\x92re not at a barn\ndance. You\xc2\x92ve gotta\xc2\x97you wanna fold them like swans. Like I showed you at\nChristmas time, remember?'
Yeah, it all just came screaming back to me. (Monica exits.) (To\nChandler) So how\xc2\x92s the game?'
I have no idea.'
What?'
Yeah! I\xc2\x92m just pretending to watch the game so I don\xc2\x92t have\nto help out with stuff.'
I don\xc2\x92t believe you! That is\xc2\x85brilliant! And Monica has no\nidea?'
Nope! Every once and a while I just scream stuff at the TV. '
Is your team winning hon?'
Yeah! Anderson just scored again! (To Phoebe) There\xc2\x92s no\nAnderson.'
Well I want to get in on this. Hey Mon? I don\xc2\x92t think I can help\nyou after all, I didn\xc2\x92t realize this game was on.'
Oh, I didn\xc2\x92t know you liked football.'
Well normally I don\xc2\x92t, but y\xc2\x92know\xc2\x85(looks at the\nTV)\xc2\x85Green Bay is playing.'
You like Green Bay?'
Well it\xc2\x92s only like my favorite bay! {Actually, it\xc2\x92s not bad.\nIt just gets a little cold in winter, but in Wisconsin winter only lasts from August to\nJune. J }'
Hey!'
Hey!'
Happy Thanksgiving!'
Aww thanks! God Will I\xc2\x92m so glad that you came! You look great! You\nmust\xc2\x92ve lost like\xc2\x85'
150 pounds. Yeah, I\xc2\x92m gonna be in one of those Subway sandwich\ncommercials.'
A pie! (Will brought a pie.)'
Oh right. All right, it\xc2\x92s no fat, it\xc2\x92s no sugar, it\xc2\x92s no\ndairy\xc2\x85it\xc2\x92s no good. Throw it out.'
You wanna meet some people? This is uh; this is my husband Chandler.\nChandler, this is Will.'
Hey.'
Oh hey. I\xc2\x92d shake your hand but uh; I\xc2\x92m really into the\ngame. Plus, I think it\xc2\x92d be better for my ego if we didn\xc2\x92t stand right next to\neach other.'
This is Phoebe.'
(nonchalantly glancing) Hey. (Turns back around.) Wow! (Looks up.) Well\ndone.'
(to Will) Wanna give me a hand?'
Sure! Monica, I can\xc2\x92t get over how great you look! You look stunning!'
Well you look incredible too! You\xc2\x92re just\xc2\x97you\xc2\x92re so fit!'
I\xc2\x92m watching the game, but I\xc2\x92m not deaf!'
Oh umm, I meant to tell you, Ross is coming.'
Ross is coming. Great! I love Ross!'
Good. And Rachel Green too. (Will stops suddenly.)'
Oh.'
Is there a problem?'
Nope. Uh, it\xc2\x92s okay. It\xc2\x92s just uh, God I hated her.'
What?'

Yeah, I hated her. She was horrible to me in high school. But hey, it was\na long time ago, I\xc2\x92m in a good place, it might be actually fun to see her again. You\ngot any cakes or cookies or something? (Starts looking.) No Will no!'
(To Phoebe) Y\xc2\x92know, it\xc2\x92s been a while since we\xc2\x92ve\nscreamed something. Maybe we should.'
Oh okay.'
Oh come on!'
Noooo!! Damn you ref! You burn in hell!!!'
Hey, what are you doing? You gotta save room, you\xc2\x92ve got almost an\nentire turkey to eat.'
Let me explain to you how the human body works. I have to warm my stomach\nfirst. Eatin\xc2\x92 chips is like stretching.'
All right.'
Don\xc2\x92t worry, Tribbianis never get full.'
I actually know what you\xc2\x92re talking about. I\xc2\x92m here to tell you\nsomething my friend, you can eat and eat and eat but nothing will ever fill that void.'
(To Monica) Who the hell is this guy?'
Will! From high school.'
Oh hey!'
(to Will) Joey.'
Hello.'
(entering) Will!'
Ross!'
Hey-hey you came! Man you look incredible! Hot stuff! (They hug and Ross\nrealizes what he said.) Hot stuff?'
It\xc2\x92s good to see you man.'
Yeah, you too. Man, so-so what are you up to?'
I\xc2\x92m a commodities broker.'
Really? Yeah that-that sounds interesting.'
Yeah, it\xc2\x92s not. But I\xc2\x92m rich and thin.'
Oh! Man I don\xc2\x92t think I\xc2\x92ve seen you since uh, Lance Davis\xc2\x92\ngraduation party.'
That was such a fun night!'
Yeah. It would\xc2\x92ve been good if we had gotten in, but still real fun.'
Yeah.'
Yeah.'
God we were lame back then. Do you remember how into dinosaurs we were?'
(laughs) Yeah.'
So what do you, what do you do now?'
So how long are you in town?'
(entering, carrying a baking dish) Hi! '
Hey sweetie. Oh good. (Takes the baking dish from her.)'
(glaring at Rachel) Rachel Green.'
Aw\xc2\x97oh, that\xc2\x92s right. Are-are you gonna be okay?'
Oh, I\xc2\x92ll-I\xc2\x92ll be fine. Just God I hate her Ross! I hate her!'
Will, high school was-was a long time ago.'
Look at her standing there with those yams! My two greatest enemies Ross
(sees Will) Oh my God Monica, who is that?'
That\xc2\x92s Will from high school!'

Oh! I do not remember him! Wow! He's really got that sexy, smoldering
thing going on. (We see Will angrily staring at Rachel.) Oh my God, he\xc2\x92s\xc2\x85 Look
at the way he\xc2\x92s just staring at me. I think he\xc2\x92s trying to mouth something to
me, but I can\xc2\x92t make it out. (Will mouths, "I hate you.")'
Okay, dinner\xc2\x92s ready!'
Good game!'
Yeah.'
Yeah. Solid effort. Solid effort.'
Oh, so who won?'
(simultaneously) Green Bay.'
(simultaneously) Detroit.'
What?'
Well the Lions technically won, but it was a moral victory for the Green\nBay\xc2\x85Mermen.'
Hi! Will, right?'
Right.'
Hi! I\xc2\x92m Rachel Green.'
Oh I-I remember you.'
Really?! Aren\xc2\x92t you sweet! I gotta tell you though, I am, I am\nhaving the hardest time placing you. Oh-oh hang on! Did we umm, did we fool around at\nLance Davis\xc2\x92 graduation party?'
You are unbelievable.'
Thank you!'
(breaking it up) Uh Rachel? Rachel, why don\xc2\x92t you sit here? (Next\nto Joey) And Will you sit way over there. (The other side of the table.)'
That\xc2\x92s it?! Even if nobody helps me I can eat that no problem. At\nleast give me a challenge!'
(laughs) This is Chandler\xc2\x92s chicken. This is the turkey. (Sets down\na huge turkey.)'
(quietly) Oh. How-how big is that?'
About nineteen pounds.'
(To Rachel) It\xc2\x92s like me when I was born.'
All right, who would uh, like some yams? Will?'
Oh, you\xc2\x92d like that wouldn\xc2\x92t ya?'
What? (Joey starts offering Ross some turkey.) Oh y\xc2\x92know what? Can\nwe please keep the chicken and the turkey and everything on the other side of the table?\nThe smell is just yuck!'
(sneeze talks) Typical.'
I\xc2\x92m sorry. What?'
I said it was typical. Typical of you, Rachel Green, Queen Rachel does\nwhatever she wants in little Rachel land. (Does a fake hair flip.)'
(To Monica) Seriously, who is this guy?'
Umm, I\xc2\x92m sorry. Do you-do you have a problem with me?'
I don\xc2\x92t know? Do I? Do I?'
I think you do.'
(To Rachel) Apparently you were umm, a little mean to him in high\nschool.'
A little mean? You made my life miserable!'
I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m\xc2\x97I had no idea. I\xc2\x92m sorry. I\xc2\x85'
Well you should be. Screw it! Bring on the yams!'
Oh Will. But you-you\xc2\x92ve worked so hard\xc2\x85'
Yams!!!! '
Okay. (Chandler grabs the dish from Monica and hands it to Will who\nstarts dishing out a large helping.)'
Uh Will umm, I just want to say that I\xc2\x92m real sorry for whatever\nI-I did to you in high school\xc2\x85'
Oh, it wasn\xc2\x92t just me. We had a club!'
You had a club?!'
That\xc2\x92s right, The I Hate Rachel Green Club!'
Whoa! My God! So what, you all just joined together to hate me?! Who\nelse was in this club?'
Me and Ross. (Points at Ross.)'
No need to point, she knows who Ross is.'
(To Ross) So you were in an I Hate Rachel club?'
Yes he was. (Holds up his hand for a high-five.)'
No. No.'
So who else was in this club?'
Uh actually, there-there was also that exchange student from Thailand but\nI-I don\xc2\x92t think he-he knew what it was.'
So Ross, we went out for two years, and you never told me you were in an\nI Hate Rachel club.'
You went out with her?! We had a pact!'
That was in high school! It\xc2\x92s not like it was binding forever.'
Then why did it have the word eternity in it?'
Okay Monica, did you know about this?!'
I swear I didn\xc2\x92t. (To Ross and Will) Hey! Is that why you guys used\nto go up to your bedroom and lock the door?'
Yeah.'
Hmm, a little relieved, I gotta say.'
Look Rach I-I\xc2\x92m sorry, okay? I\xc2\x85I was a stupid kid, okay? The\nonly reason I joined\xc2\x85'
Co-founded!'

\xc2\x85co-founded. Co-founded the club was because I was insanely in love\nwith you. Obviously I didn\xc2\x92t handle it very well. But if you think about it the I\nHate Rachel Club was really the I Love Rachel Club.'
Uh, except that it was really the I Hate Rachel Club.'
Okay. So what? You guys would just like get together and like just say\nmean things about me?'
Well, we did a little more than that.'
No-no! No-no. No-no.'
What?! What else did you do?'
We started a rumor.'
What rumor?'
Oh, come on Will! Just take off your shirt and tell us!'
Ross!'
It was no big deal. We-we\xc2\x85said that the rumor was\xc2\x85that\numm\xc2\x85you had both\xc2\x85male and female reproductive parts.'
What?!'
That\xc2\x92s right! We said your parents flipped a coin, decided to raise\nyou as a girl, but you still had a hint of a penis.'
(shocked) Oh my God!'
You started that?!'
What?! You heard that?! (Goes and stands behind Joey.)'
Everyone at our school heard it!'
Everybody at my school heard it! You were the hermaphrodite\ncheerleader from Long Island?!'

Oh no!!!! Oh my God!! This is all making so much sense to me now! This\nis why Adam Carter wouldn\xc2\x92t go out with me! This is why Billy Tratt would just stay\nin this region! (Motions to her breasts.) (Joey has turned around.)'
Actually, Billy Tratt is gay now. So-so that one\xc2\x92s not really our\nfault.'
Monica, how come you never told me this?!'
I thought it might be true. And I was afraid that you were gonna cry and\nthen show it to me.'
Joey stop staring! There\xc2\x92s nothing there! It\xc2\x92s not true!'
I\xc2\x92m afraid I\xc2\x92m gonna need proof.'
Oh! (Hits him and storms out.)'
You are my Everest.'
Joey, you don\xc2\x92t have to finish that.'

Oh yes I do. Otherwise what\xc2\x92s next? Today I\xc2\x92m just a guy who
can\xc2\x92t finish a turkey, but tomorrow I\xc2\x92m the guy who eats half a Powerbar,
wraps up the rest, and puts in the fridge? No! No, I just\xc2\x85I just\xc2\x97I gotta change
my pants. (Gets up and heads for the door.) Jeans have no give. (Exits.)'
(entering carrying a book) Okay! Okay! Listen to what Sean McMahon wrote\nin my yearbook senior year, "Dear Rach, you\xc2\x92re such a good person." Not\ngirl! Person!'
Rach, I think you\xc2\x92re reading a little too much into it.'
(reading what he wrote again) "Dear Rach, you\xc2\x92re a great\nperson. Sorry about your tiney-wienie." (Will laughs.)'
Look, what do you want me to do? Do you want me to call everyone in the\nentire school and tell them it wasn\xc2\x92t true?!'
Yes!'
Could you also tell them I\xc2\x92m skinny now?'
Oh! Me too!'
Well look-look I\xc2\x92m not calling anybody! Okay? It was like a million\nyears ago!'
I don\xc2\x92t care how long ago it was! You told people that I was half\nand half! Y\xc2\x92know what? I just want to point out I never did anything to hurt you in\nhigh school.'
That\xc2\x92s not totally true.'
What?'
What?'
Well you-you did start that rumor about Ross making out with Mrs.\nAltman, our 50-year-old librarian.'
(shocked) (To Rachel) How did you know that?!!!!'
It\xc2\x92s true?!!'
No.'
Yes it is! I saw you guys going at it behind the card catalog!'
Mrs. Altman? She also made out with Takaka Ci-Kek the night before he went\nback to Thailand.'
I\xc2\x92m sorry. When you were in high school you made out with a\n50-year-old woman?'
Hey! She didn\xc2\x92t look 50!'
Did she look 16?'
Ohh, there\xc2\x92s a picture of her in the yearbook actually.'
Oh! (They all look.) Wow!'
She didn\xc2\x92t photograph well!'
Well, she probably wasn\xc2\x92t familiar with the process having spent\nmost of her life sitting for oil paintings!'
So how did this happen? Did she, did she lure you to an early bird\ndinner?'

I was working late in the library one afternoon. It was just the two of\nus. She needed some help with her word jumble. And one thing led to another. If you must\nknow, Anita was very gentle and tender. May she rest in peace\xc2\x85'
Didn\xc2\x92t she walk with a cane?'
Only when it was damp!! (To Rachel) I can\xc2\x92t believe you-you told\npeople about this?! Everybody knew?! Y\xc2\x92know what? (To Will) I\xc2\x92m back in the\nclub!'
Yeah! (They high-five.)'
I wanna join!'
Wh\xc2\x97Phoebe!!'
I\xc2\x92m sorry. I\xc2\x92m sorry. I never got to be in a club. I-I\ndidn\xc2\x92t go to high school, but three of us would meet behind a dumpster to learn\nFrench. Bonjour.'

All right, y\xc2\x92know\xc2\x97Fine! You guys have your stupid little club,\nbut I would just like to say is what you did to me is way worse than what I did to you!\nYou gave me a tiney-wienie! (Will laughs.)'

All right, listen you\xc2\x92re just being silly. Rachel, even with that\nrumor you were one of the most popular girls in school and everyone wanted to be like you.\nOne girl wanted to be like you so much she stuffed her pants with a Tootsie Roll!'
Wow\xc2\x85'
And Ross, if it weren\xc2\x92t for Rachel\xc2\x92s rumor I mean no one in\nhigh school would even know who you were. She put you on the map!'
As a romancer of the elderly.'
Hey! Mrs. Altman was the kind of woman you could tell she used to be\npretty.'
The eyes\xc2\x85did still sparkle.'

Hey guys this stuff is just so way in the past. You-you\xc2\x92ve been\nthrough so much since then. And right now you\xc2\x92ve got so much more important stuff\ngoing on in your life. Can\xc2\x92t you just let this go?'
She\xc2\x92s right.'
Yeah. I mean we are having a baby together.'
Hold on! You got her pregnant?'
Yeah.'
Are ya getting married?'
Nope.'
So you knocked her up but you\xc2\x92re not gonna marry her. Dude! (Wants\nanother high-five and Ross ignores him.) Anybody?'
Okay. (Goes over and hugs him.) It\xc2\x92s exactly how I\xc2\x92d imagined\nit would be.'
(entering, wearing the maternity pants from earlier) All right\nwhere\xc2\x92s that turkey!'
Joey! Those are my maternity pants!'
Not now! These are my Thanksgiving pants!'
Well that\xc2\x92s it. I\xc2\x92m done. Whew! (Wipes his forehead.) There come\nthe meat sweats. (Chandler hands him a towel and he wipes his face.)'
Well Joey, we\xc2\x92re all\xc2\x85we\xc2\x92re all very proud of you.'
Yes, I believe we can expect a call from the President any moment now.'
Is there anything we can do for you?'
No just, nobody press on my stomach.'
You can keep those pants by the way.'
Whoa\xc2\x97hey\xc2\x97wh-wh-what do you got there? What is that? Pie?'
Yeah, you want some?'

Ah, just cut me a little sliver. (Monica prepares to cut a little sliver.)\nA little bigger. (Monica prepares to cut a bigger piece.) Little bigger. (Monica moves the\nknife again.) What?! Are you afraid you\xc2\x92re gonna run out?! Cut me a real piece!'
